text: Cameron A. Morrison was an American Democratic Party politician. He was the governor of North Carolina from 1921 to 1926. His term as governor was notable for various reformsGOVERNOR CAMERON MORRISON, n.d., 1921-1926The North Carolina Democratic handbook, prepared by the State Democratic Committee, 1922. J.D. Norwood, chairman [and others, P.39-40]Title: Labor Legislation of 1921 : Bulletin of the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics, No. 308, P.193-195 including legislation providing for mother's pensions.The Weight of Their Votes Southern Women and Political Leverage in the 1920s By Lorraine Gates Schuyler, 2008, P.209 ==References== Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Governors of North Carolina Category:Year of birth missing Category:Year of death missing
title: Cameron A. Morrison
